description: Date on which the survey was conducted
Rocky intertidal site where survey was conducted
The individual(s) who conducted the survey
Type of ecological substrate within each plot area. Defined by organism/group forming the majority of the substrate (Fucus, barnacles, or mussels)
Permanent plot areas (marked by bolts) defining five plots for each substrate at each site. Each plot area measures 75cm x 50 cm
The dimensions of the plot area within which mobile invertebrates are being measured/counted
The location of a subplot within the overall plot area
Taxonomic name for a given taxon code
Common vernacular description of what a given code represents (i.e. acorn barnacle, dead acorn barnacle)
Component of the survey for a given observation (Measured individuals, Non-measured individuals, Littorine counts, Large limpet counts, Small limpet counts, Medium limpet counts)
The number of individuals of a given taxon and size (when measured) within the subplot area, or the total number of individuals within the subplot area if size not measured.
Size to the nearest mm of measured individuals. - measured in the field using calipers
The individual(s) who entered the data
The individual(s) who quality controlled the data
Records anything of note about a given observation
